result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markell Sinclair Hughes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Markell Sinclair Hughes.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests an additional status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Markell Sinclair Hughes.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in court, appear in person with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40. Date given by Br. 40 Clerk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with Victor Fitzpatrick (co-actor); AC (12/19/1976); AMK (09/20/1967); RDH (11/21/1997); TLR (08/16/1963)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Markell Sinclair Hughes in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Markell Sinclair Hughes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 5 and 7.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
